de.griefed.serverpackcreator

Class AddonsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.griefed.serverpackcreator.AddonsHandler

  • @Component
public class AddonsHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    The AddonHandler provides the ability to load JAR-files from the addons-directory.
    This allows the execution of additional code after a server pack has been generated.
    Please note: I am not responsible for data loss or damage caused by using addons. I have no way of verifying whether any addon used does something harmful, neither can I verify their origin. The way to handle this is pretty much the same as with all other software out there: If you do not trust it, do not use it.

    An example of an addon can be viewed on GitHub at ServerPackCreator-ServerPack-Addon-Example

      • AddonsHandler

        @Autowired
public AddonsHandler(LocalizationManager injectedLocalizationManager,
                                ApplicationProperties injectedApplicationProperties,
                                BooleanUtilities injectedBooleanUtilities,
                                ListUtilities injectedListUtilities,
                                StringUtilities injectedStringUtilities,
                                ConfigUtilities injectedConfigUtilities)
        Constructor

        Used for Dependency Injection.

        Receives an instance of LocalizationManager or creates one if the received one is null. Required for use of localization.

        Parameters:
        injectedLocalizationManager - Instance of LocalizationManager required for localized log messages.
        injectedApplicationProperties - Instance of ApplicationProperties required for various different things.
        injectedConfigUtilities - Instance of ConfigUtilities.
        injectedStringUtilities - Instance of StringUtilities.
        injectedListUtilities - Instance of ListUtilities.
        injectedBooleanUtilities - Instance of BooleanUtilities.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeAddons

        void initializeAddons()
        Calls setListOfAddons() and setListOfServerPackAddons(List) in order to generate and set our list of addons overall and a list of addons which will be run right after server pack-generation.

      • getListOfAddons

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListOfAddons()
        Getter for the list of all installed addons.
        Returns:
        String List. A list of all addons found when ServerPackCreator was started.

      • setListOfAddons

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> setListOfAddons()
        Setter for the list of installed addons. Creates a list of all JAR-files in the addon-directory.
        Returns:
        String List. A list of all addons found when ServerPackCreator was started.

      • getListOfServerPackAddons

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListOfServerPackAddons()
        Getter for the list of addons which will be executed after the generation of a server pack has finished.
        Returns:
        String List. The list of addons which will be executed after the generation of a server pack has finished.

      • setListOfServerPackAddons

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> setListOfServerPackAddons(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listOfInstalledAddons)
        Setter for the list of server pack addons. Server pack addons are executed right after a server pack was generated. This checks all JAR-files previously gathered in setListOfAddons() for the setting in their addon.conf and whether it has a valid configuration of serverpackcreator.addon.type=serverpack. If said configuration is found, the JAR-file is added to the list of server pack addons.
        Parameters:
        listOfInstalledAddons - Receives a list of all addons installed.
        Returns:
        String List. A list of all addons of which the configuration states that they are for server packs.

      • runServerPackAddons

        void runServerPackAddons(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
        Runs every server pack addon with the passed configuration model, allowing for further customization and actions after a server pack has been generated. The base path in which ServerPackCreator itself resides in is passed as the last argument, making it easier for you to work with server pack files and the like.
        For an example of a Server Pack Addon, see the example addon ServerPackCreator-ServerPack-Addon-Example

        NOTE: All addons are run in the work/temp/addon_name-directory. Be aware of that when creating your addons!

        Parameters:
        configurationModel - The instance of ConfigurationModel with which a server pack was generated.
